channel.title: What should my first tutorial be?
channel.description:
I'm going to have some free time aside from school that I thought I would use to write some tutorials. However, I'm not sure where to start, or what tutorials to make, some of you may know that I'm an advanced web developer, and I love helping out! So, I've included tons of tutorials titles below, including Security, HTML/CSS, and PHP, later on in a month or so I'll do some Javascript. Comment below what you think I should release a tutorial for! I'll close this in two weeks and whatever got voted on, I'll make a tutorial for, if you have a different suggestion, please comment below and let me know. I've realized that there are tons of PHP projects that I can do a tutorial on I looked at about 12GB of files from my previous PHP projects I've done, and basically listed what I've done.
[b]Website Security[/b] - Protection from Remote File Inclusion (RFI) - Develop code that is safe from SQL Injection - Prevent cross-Site scripting or XXS - Protection from Local File Inclusion (LFI) - Directory Traversal Attack - Keep Passwords out of your site files - Obscuring data with encoding - Verifying data with hashes - Storing passwords securely - Check and confirm password strength - Dealing with lost passwords securely - Encrypting and Decrypting data - Store encrypted data in a file or database - Share various encrypted data with another website - Detecting SSL - Encrypting Emal (with GPG; GNU Privacy Guard)
[b]General HTML/CSS[/b] - Creating an advanced drop-down menu - Creating a two column website - Creating attractive log-in forms - Style an image gallery - Design an attractive homepage - Styling a calendar - Give hyperlinks a good look - Create a page suited for printing - Graphical Backgrounds
[b]General PHP/SQL[/b] - Creating a nice log-in system - Everything you need to know about strings - Numbers, generating random numbers, calculating exponents, operate on a series of integers (math driven) - Correct format for doing dates and times - Everything regarding arrays - Everything about variables - Efficiently using functions the correct way - Cookies (Setting, Reading, and Deleting cookies) - Safe Redirection to an off-site location - Correct way to store sessions in a database - Detect user information (IP Address, Browser, etc.) - Basic use of HTTP Authentication - Compress web output with GZIP - Logging errors locally - Read and set Environment Variables and Configuration Variables - Communicating with-in Apache
[b]Forms[/b] - Processing and Validating form input - Link together multipage forms - Processing Uploaded Files (Security-Based) - Escaping various form input characters - Create drop down menus based on the current day of the week (random one)
[b]Database Access and Security[/b] - Using Text-File Databases that are stored locally - Use DBM Databases (more secure, stable, and scalable way to store simple data other than text-files) - Everything regarding Queries in one tutorial - Logging Debug information and errors
[b]Web Automation[/b] - Various ways to fetch URLs (GET or POST method, Using Cookies, Headers) - Fetch an HTTPS-secure URL - Extracting all links from and HTML file - Remove all HTML and PHP tags (script) - Conversion from ASCII to HTML and back - Finding broken links
[b]Graphics[/b] - Drawing Lines, Rectangles, and Polygons - Drawing Arcs, Ellipses, and Circles - Drawing with patterned lines - Drawing Text (sounds silly) - Building Dynamic Images - Serve images securely - Generate bar charts from poll results
[b]Files[/b] - Create or Open a Local File - Create a temporary file - Open a remote file - Reading from standard input - Reading a file into a String - Counting lines, paragraphs, or records in a file - Processing every word in a file - Read a particular line in a file - Reading Configuration Files - Writing to standard output - Lock and secure a file
[b]Directories[/b] - Get and set file timestamps - Get file information - Deleting a file - Copy or move a file - Process all files in a directory - Fetting a list of filenames - Site Search
[b]Client-Sided PHP[/b] - Reading from the keyboard - Reading passwords - Display a GUI widget in a window - Respond to user actions - Display Menus - Program a command shell - Display Weather Conditions
